description: One star accommodation with five star memories.  For the explorers, the adventurous and maybe those that just want to relax in a hammock at the edge of the world.  We strive to be kind to each other and to the environment so we use as little plastic and concrete as possible, instead you'll find locally sourced wood and grass as the construction material of choice. Our food follows the same rule, (mostly) local ingredients cooked from scratch by local staff for excellent results.  Within seconds of getting off the boat onto our beach you'll find yourself part of our family, this is somewhere you can really find seclusion and space to relax.  Koh Ta Kiev is the least populated of the 3 main Sihanoukville islands, perfect if you want to get away from it all. ***Property Policies & Conditions: 1. Cancellation policy: 1 day before arrival. 2. Check in from 12:30 to 23:00. 3. Check out before 9:30 noon. 4. Payment upon arrival by cash only. 5. Reception working hours 07:00-23:00. 6. No age restriction. 7. Taxes included. 8. Breakfast not included. 9. Smoking allowed. FAQ: Q. How do I get there? A. Our boat to the island departs from what used to be "Banana beach bungalows" location on Otres2 beach at 12:00 (10.561006, 103.557825). We also pick up from Shop 29 on Ream Beach at 12:30 (10.519063, 103.610997), this is sometimes more convenient if coming from Phnom Penh, Kampot or the Airport. You can put those coordinates into Google or Bing maps to find the exact locations. The boat cost 15$ per person for an open return ticket, and can be paid when you arrive at The Last Point. Q. How do I get from Koh Rong or Koh Rong Samloem to Koh Ta Kiev? A. Take the 9:30 boat to Serendipity beach, take a tuk tuk to Banana Beach Bungalows (Otres2), take our ferry at 12:00 to The Last Point ($15 per open return ticket) Q. Is there a direct ferry from Koh Rong or Koh Rong Samloem? A. No.  It takes the KR and KRS speedboats about 45 mins to do the 15km from those islands to Serendipty beach, it takes our longtail boat about 45 minutes to do the 5km journey from Otres2 (Banana Beach Bungalows) which is about a 25 minute tuk tuk (use Passapp to book for cheaper rides) ride away from Serendipity.  Unfortunately there is no direct ferry, KR and KRS are about 30-40km away from Koh Ta Kiev which would be an unsustainable 2 hour speedboat ride or an uncomfortable over ocean 4 hour longtail ride. Q. I'm arriving late in Sihanoukville, can I take a ferry to you later than 12:00? A. We only operate one ferry per day and can't guarantee any other services so if you are going to be too late you could either enjoy a night in Otres or try to find another ferry provider.  Banana Beach Bungalows (Otres 2) or Mangroves And More (in the village) are good places to try if you want to stay a night.  For later ferries, do ensure they go to the correct side of the island, many go to the north end which is a 40 minute trek through jungle to us.   Our neighbour "Kactus" often has a boat departing mid afternoon from Banana beach but we can't guarantee their service. Q. I'm too late to come today, can I come tomorrow? A. We understand, we're all travellers ourselves and know what it can be like.  We never charge for cancellations or modifications to bookings.  It would help us out if you could make the change on your online booking yourself though.  Most of the time it won't matter, we can just adjust your booking by a day and you can just join us a day later.  Relax, smile and we'll see you soon. Q. I'm arriving in Sihanoukville by bus from Phnom Pehn/Kampot/Kep, how do I get to Ream? A. If you will be on time for the 12:30 boat at Ream then get off the bus on the highway near Sihanoukville airport.  See the next question for the rest of the information. Q. I'm arriving in Sihanoukville airport, can I get a transfer? A. We don't offer a taxi service but our boat does pick up from the beach nearby the airport at 12:30 each day.  You could try the PassApp application before talking to the airport taxi drivers, it tends to be much cheaper, expect to pay around $4 - $8 for the 10 minute journey.  Your destination would be Shop29 on Ream Beach (https://goo.gl/maps/5EnVveNCHY2JY8cM8).  If you need a later pick up it is possible from Ream beach only but let us know in advance the date and time to make sure the boat is available and call 088 502 6930 when you set off in the taxi, we'll send the boat over to you and it's about a 15 minute boat journey, tickets costing $15 for an open return back to the mainland. Q. What time does the boat return to the mainland? A. The boat leaves the island at 09:30, can drop off at Ream beach at 09:50 by request and arrives at Banana Beach Bungalows on Otres 2 by 10:30 (or sooner if nobody needs to go to Ream) Q. What should I bring with me? A. We recommend: Swimming clothes, a rechargeable torch, coconut oil (prevents sand fly bites) and mosquito repellent (we have fewer mosquitos than the mainland but there's no harm in being careful). description: Eighty8 Backpackers hostel is an oasis within the heart of a bustling Phnom Penh with a swimming pool for that much needed cooling dip. We are not only a fun social hostel, but also a great place to chill out, relax, meet fellow travelers or make new friends, and of course, we can party too. Enjoy our amazing FREE Breakfast bar, available with all HW bookings. There are live eggs of choice and noodle stations preparing your food fresh to order, with lots of vegetarian options. No better way to start your day, also with unlimited tea & coffee, strict times apply. We love our location, away from the seedier, noisier parts of the city you get a real insight to Cambodian city life and Khmer culture, with local shops & a street market on our doorstep, along with many Khmer style restaurants & coffee shops in neighbouring streets. There is even a KFC and a Starbucks nearby for those missing a taste from home, along with four of the city’s top restaurants within easy walking. We are a short 3-minute walk from Wat Phnom, the traditional centre of the city and close to the Central, Old & Night Markets. The Night Market is the starting point of Phnom Penh’s famous Riverside and Royal Palace area, making our hostel a great place to escape the bustle of the city while remaining near to great attractions and nightlife. Everything within the city is only a $2-$4 Tuk-Tuk ride away, so we always recommend using our in-house Tuk-Tuk share sign up sheet to save costs. All Eighty8 rooms come with A/C, fan & hot showers as standard and we have free high speed Wi-Fi throughout the hostel. We have both Twin and Double bed Private rooms, for added flexibility, they all have en-suite bathrooms, with some rooms having balconies, room safes, wardrobes and daily water along with tea & coffee making facilities. Our dormitory rooms come with big personal lockers and en-suite shared bathroom facilities and each bed has USB charger socket and reading light. A recent addition to the hostel are the new sleeping pods, a dormitory style room with private sleeping pods & lockers with shared private en-suite bathroom cubicles. All pods come with reading light, USB charger sockets, fans and room AC. Eighty8 has a large common area with a big screen for sports and events along with a Restaurant (open 7am to 10pm) & Bar (open 7am to 12am) serving both Khmer and western delights along with cold Cambodia beers and fab cocktails. There is also a late night snack menu from 10pm to 12am, for anyone with the late night munchies. We have a swimming pool set up for pool volleyball and a basketball hoop for a bit more pool fun. We have a Pool table that is free to use, so watch out for the Killer pool competitions and free drink games. Join in and make new friends, head to a nightclub together or arrange to share a tour. Alternatively grab a book from our free book swap library and read in daybed or beanbag, sit back, chill out and let the world go by. description: 'Robinson Bungalows requires a full prepayment with  Paypal' Robinson Bungalows is unplug from the noisy world and escape to a deserted sunset beach. Our bungalows are made from wood with straw roofs and double beds with a mosquito net for your comfort. There are lights in the room and on the terrace and nicely located hammocks to relax and soak up the sea views. Robinson Bungalows is completely off the grid. We use 100% solar panels for energy and store rain water for washing. Come and enjoy the luxury of simple life. Enjoy a nap in your seaside hammock, listen to the birds sing, swim through the colorful coral and stare eye to eye with a parrot fish. If you are looking for adventure, you can take a dive course next door or explore the beautiful jungle of Koh Rong Samloem. The Lazy Beach Boat brings you directly to Robinson Bungalows without trekking through the jungle. You can book your boat ticket with josh@lazybeachcambodia.com (please us this email only for boat bookings, for all other questions please send a email to info@robinsonbungalows.com or messenger from your booking channel). Please arrive 1/2 an hour before departure in the Lazy Beach Office. The boat leaves at 1pm each day. The  boat is not waiting for any delay, and you have to take a speed boat to the island. You can buy tickets at any travel agency or at lazy beach office. The Lazy Beach Booking Office is situated on Serendipity Beach Road at The Dive Shop Cambodia Office. It is easy to find by using Google Maps and searching for The Dive Shop. The ride to and from the island takes ~2 hours.  The way back to Sihanoukville the boat leaves 8.30 from Robinson Bungalows. Whenever possible you arrive at Ochheuteal Beach in Sihanoukville. The boat cost $10-per-person and one way. If your bus is late or any other problem by later arriving send an e-mail to josh@lazybeachcambodia.com Due windy and wavy conditions (most between may-september) the boat will arrive and leave Saracen Bay on Koh Rong Samloem. Our remote beach is NOT operated by any of the speedferry companies. Only a few companies stop at the jetty closest to our path, BuvaSea and G.T.V.C.. Please book your ticket with your guesthouse in Cambodia, any travel agency, the ferry offices in town or online. Your destination port on the island will be Saracen Bay, from where you will start a ~35 minute jungle trek to Sunset Beach. You’ll find the beginning of the trail right behind the dive shop. If you bring some mosquito repellent, a bottle of water and proper shoes you are perfectly prepared for a fun jungle trek. Maybe you even wanna make your life a bit easier and leave your big bags with your guesthouse or a travel agency on the mainland.  View House Rules

description: Welcome to Coast 23 Hostel & Bar, a community driven hideaway on one of Cambodia's most beautiful and untouched islands. Ideally situated on the edge of 'M'Pai Bay' fishing village and the unspoiled and famous 'Plankton Beach', Coast 23 offers its guests a true island retreat. Inbetween relaxing or exploring, Mama and the rest of the Coast 23 family is here to cater to all your culinary needs, providing both local and western infused delights to suit every palette. description: Situated in a prime position on the beautiful M’Pay Bay area of Koh Rong Sanleom, guests are just minutes from the stunning beaches and crystal clear water that surrounds the island. Whether you have come to relax or party at Yellow Moon you have the option to do both! Chill out in our hammocks and tree houses through the day then at night enjoy a drink at our fully loaded beach bar where we have a bonfire and fire show every night as well as beer pong, live music nights and themed nights ( and of course numerous happy hours running through the night including buy 1 get 1 free buckets or spirite !) One of the  key attractions at The Yellow Moon is that we are situated right on the famous plankton beach, simply wait till its dark, splash about in the water and let the magic happen! Being on an island there are a number of water activities to do. Every day we run a boat trip which takes you to the local reefs for snorkeling and swimming, guests can then fish Khmer style before finishing the day watching the sunset whilst heading back for a BBQ. All equipment is provided. We also have a dive shop on the premises offering a number of dive packages with our fully qualified instructors.  Top tip before coming to the island! There are no ATMs here and no way to process card transactions, so remember to bring enough cash for your stay. Cambodian ATMs issue $100 dollar bills, getting this changed before you arrive will be a great help to the hostel and local businesses. The best way to reach us from the mainland is by using a boat company called GTVC at Sihanoukville pier. They run a regular service to M'Pai Bay (where we are on Koh Rong Samleom.) Times are: 08;00, 11;00, 14:00, 16:00. We recommend waiting until you get the pier before buying your ticket. We also sell return tickets here at  the hostel. TOP TIP- Do not get off the boat anywhere other than M' Pai Bay.  View House Rules

description: Welcome to Beach Park Hostel & Tree Bar on the idyllic island of Koh Rong Samloem. The Hostel provides varying levels of accommodation including: 3 Double Bed Private Bungalows (Elm, Oak, & Pine), 1 Twin Bed Private Bungalow (Maple), 5 (4 Mixed Gender/ 1 Female Only) Air Conditioned Single Bed Dorms (12 Beds Per Dorm) & 2 Fan Single Bed Dorms (8 Beds Per Dorm) ensuring that we are able to meet the requirements of all our potential customers. The resort has developed a reputation as the ‘go to location’ for the islands night entertainment, providing mesmerizing nightly fire-shows, live music and the perfect atmosphere to socialize and cultivate those lifelong friendships, which we all travel for. We are highly accessible from the mainland of Shianoukville with speed ferries running very frequently; although speed ferry tickets can be purchased from Occhueteal pier, we advise that you purchase your tickets online to avoid any disappointment. description: The Ivy is the longest-running, Western-run budget guesthouse in Siem Reap. The original Ivy first opened it’s doors in 1999 and has been catering to budget travellers ever since. The Western/Khmer family environment provides a unique and authentic Siem Reap experience. Famous for its Friday Tapas and charity quiz nights, it's a great place to meet expats and locals.  Relax in our lounge, enjoy a meal at our fantastic restaurant, and discover the ‘Kingdom of Wonder’. The Ivy is owned by Vannary—a well known chef and restaurateur in Cambodia—and Kathryn, who first came to Cambodia as part of the Lara Croft: Tomb Raider movie crew. Kathryn fell in love with The Ivy and made great friends with Vannary and her husband Karl. Sadly, Karl passed away in 2011 but together Vannary and Kathryn continue his Ivy bar legacy.  Kathryn still works in the movie industry and will happily chat about the Tomb Raider and other big films she works on.   Vannary is the author of the fantastic cook book Vann's Shared Secrets, which features home-cooked Khmer recipes and her take on Western cuisine. The guesthouse has 20 rooms (6 single w/fan, 12 double w/fan and 2 double a/c) all with en-suite facilities. The guesthouse has a locally renowned restaurant and bar, balcony chill out area, lounge, pool table and high speed wifi throughout. Rooms are simple and clean and provide a perfect place to stay for travelers keen for an authentic experience of Siem Reap before the rapid development of recent years. The Ivy provides guests with clean linen, towels, a laundry service and bicycle rental as well as first class advice for guests on local tours, excursions and onward travel. The Ivy hosts regular events including a fantastic tapas evening with everything on the menu for $1.50  View House Rules
